intro: Deppea keniae, commonly known as the Kenia tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Deppea keniae is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
